Designing for the Internet of Things

A hands-on introductory course exploring the Internet of Things and connected product experiences.

About Deliverables Readings Resources Schedule Additional Info Labs

Schedule

Week (Beginning) Summary Assignments
1 (Jan 15) Introduction to IoT and Connected Products Mini Assignment - Product Hunt
Readings #1 due
2 (Jan 22) Design Approaches for Networked Devices Creative Assignment I
Readings #2 due
3 (Jan 29) Exploring Ambience and Tangible Data Creative Assignment II
Readings #3 due
4 (Feb 5) Envisioning Connectivity for Domestic Settings Creative Assignment III
Readings #4 due
5 (Feb 12) Considering Connectivity Creative Assignment IV
Readings #5 due
6 (Feb 19) Looking to the Future Final Assignment:
Familiarize + Defamiliarize
Readings #6 due
7 (Feb 26) IoT Ecosystems Final Assignment:
Vision + 1st Cut Prototypes
8 (Mar 5) Final Presentations Final Assignment: Presentation, Demonstration

Detailed Schedule

Week 1: Introduction to IoT and Connected Products

Tuesday Jan 16 Thursday Jan 18
General Introduction to the course. Introduction to Particle.io framework
Introduction to IoT and ‘the Disappearing Computer’ Introduction to basic electronics for IoT
In Class Exercise #1: Defining the Internet of Things Building a first connected circuit
Assignments Given
  • Discovery #1 - Product Hunt
  • Readings #1 - Introduction to the IoT and Connected Products

Week 2: Designing for Networked Devices

Tuesday Jan 23 Thursday Jan 25
Discussing Case Studies and Product Hunt Programming for IoT Continued
In Class Exercise 2: Open Source Alternatives Building a basic connected sensor platform
Introduction to Creative Assignment 1 Prototyping Creative Assignment 1
Assignments Given
  • Discovery #2 - Starting points
  • Creative Assignment #1 - Home Hack
  • Readings #2 - Understanding Ambience

Week 3: Exploring Ambience and Tangible Data

Tuesday Jan 30 Thursday Feb 1
In Class Exercise 3- Speed Dating for Ideas Designing Ambient Behaviour
Discussion: Ambience and the IoT Working with APIs + Data
Introduction to Creative Project #2 Controlling Advanced Outputs
Assignments Given
  • Discovery #3 - An ambient device
  • Creative Assignment #2 - Ambient Affect
  • Readings #3 - Envisioning Connectivity in the Home

Week 4: Envisioning Connectivity for Domestic Settings

Tuesday Feb 6 Thursday Feb 8
Designing Connectivity in Domestic Settings Project Review
In Class Exercise 4-a and 4-b Communicating with two or more devices
Groupwork on Assignment #2 Introduction/Prototyping Creative Project #3
Assignments Given
  • Discovery #4 - Social Object
  • Creative Assignment #3 - Connected Intimacy
  • Readings #4 - Considering Connectivity

Week 5: Considering Connectivity

Tuesday Feb 13 Thursday Feb 15
The Dark Side of the IoT Project Review
In Class Exercise V - Mapping Considerations and Concerns Project Review
Introduction to Creative Project #4 Developing Creative Project #4
Assignments Given
  • Discovery #5 - A critical reflection on one IoT concern
  • Creative Assignment #4 - The Cutest Chainsaw
  • Readings #5 - Designing Smart Products

Week 6: Looking to the Future

Tuesday Feb 20 Thursday Feb 22
Project Review Milestone I: Familiarize
Introduction to Final project In-class critique of initial research
Brainstorming for final project Teamwork for final project
Assignments Given
  • Final Project Milestone I: Familiarize
  • Final Project Milestone II: Defamiliarize
  • Final Project Milestone III: Vision Proposal
  • Readings #6 - Future Connections

Week 7: IoT Ecosystems

Tuesday Feb 27 Thursday Mar 1
Milestone II: Vision Proposal Milestone III: Initial prototype
In-class critique of initial proposals In-class critique of initial prototype
Teamwork and prototyping for final project Teamwork and prototyping for final project
Assignments Given
  • Final Project Milestone IV: Prototype and Present - Vision Crits
  • Final Project Milestone V: Prototype and Present - 1st Cut Prototypes
  • Final Project Milestone V: Prototype and Present - Draft Presentation

Week 8: Final Showcase

Final projects will be demonstrated in an open review and critique with invited faculty on Wednesday 8th March from 2pm-4pm

Tuesday Mar 6 Thursday Mar 8
Milestone IV: Presentation Draft Setup and dry run
In-class presentation of final vision presentation Presentations to Faculty (5 mins per team)
Final Hacksession for Prototypes Tour/open review of demonstrations.
Assignments Given
  • Final Project Milestone VI: Prototype and Present - Final Showcase
  • Final Project Milestone VII: Prototype and Present - Final Documentation

Designing for the Internet of Things - Spring 2018
Course developed by Daragh Byrne · Made in Pittsburgh at Carnegie Mellon.
